condition.description:
Tobacco use is the most common preventable cause of death. About half of the people who don't quit smoking will die of smoking-related problems. Quitting smoking is important for your health.

Soon after you quit, your circulation begins to improve, and your blood pressure starts to return to normal. Your sense of smell and taste return, and it's easier for you to breathe. In the long term, giving up tobacco can help you live longer. Your risk of getting cancer decreases with each year you stay smoke-free.

Quitting is not easy. You may have short-term affects such as weight gain, irritability, and anxiety. Some people try several times before they succeed. There are many ways to quit smoking. Some people stop "cold turkey." Others benefit from step-by-step manuals, counseling, or medicines or products that help reduce nicotine addiction. Your health care provider can help you find the best way for you to quit.

NIH: National Cancer Institute
condition.name: Smoking cessation

carousel_items: Plan a quit date with your doctor and then start taking Chantix 1 week before that date. Starting Chantix before you quit helps build up the medicine in your body while you are still able to smoke a few more days.
Be sure to tell your doctor if you have depression or mental health problems.
Sign up for the easy-to-use GETQUIT Plan included in your Chantix starter pack for strategies to keep you off cigarettes.
You should always take Chantix with food and a full glass of water to reduce side effects.
The most common side effect is nausea, which can make you feel like you are going to throw up.
Quitting is hard. If you slip-up and have a cigarette, don’t give up. You can still keep taking Chantix.

basics.benefits_moa: Chantix binds to nicotine receptors in the brain, preventing actual nicotine from releasing dopamine. Lower dopamine levels cause fewer cravings and withdrawal symptoms.
basics.bottom_line: Chantix is a great way to help you quit smoking and stay off cigarettes, even though many people have nausea with it.
downsides: You can have withdrawal symptoms like irritability and difficulty sleeping once you stop smoking.
Patients taking Chantix can gain weight if they substitute smoking for food.
Changing your daily smoking patterns and keeping yourself busy can be difficult at first.
Rarely, some people have had suicidal thoughts while taking Chantix.
Smoking can affect how some drugs work in your body. Once you quit, your doctor may need to adjust the doses of certain medicines you're taking.

downsides_processed.orig: You can have withdrawal symptoms like irritability and difficulty sleeping once you stop smoking.
Patients taking Chantix can gain weight if they substitute smoking for food.
Changing your daily smoking patterns and keeping yourself busy can be difficult at first.
Rarely, some people have had suicidal thoughts while taking Chantix.
Smoking can affect how some drugs work in your body. Once you quit, your doctor may need to adjust the doses of certain medicines you're taking.

upsides: 44% of people taking Chantix were able to quit during their initial 12 week treatment.
Quitting smoking can significantly lower your risk of lung cancer, heart disease, and stroke.
An occasional slip-up doesn't mean you have relapsed.
When you quit smoking, your food might taste better and your breath won’t smell like smoke.
You'll save a lot of money when you stop buying cigarettes.

upsides_processed.orig: 44% of people taking Chantix were able to quit during their initial 12 week treatment.

drugs.name: Chantix

carousel_items_processed.orig: Plan a quit date with your doctor and then start taking Chantix 1 week before that date. Starting Chantix before you quit helps build up the medicine in your body while you are still able to smoke a few more days.
Be sure to tell your doctor if you have depression or mental health problems.
Sign up for the easy-to-use GETQUIT Plan included in your Chantix starter pack for strategies to keep you off cigarettes.
You should always take Chantix with food and a full glass of water to reduce side effects.
The most common side effect is nausea, which can make you feel like you are going to throw up.
Quitting is hard. If you slip-up and have a cigarette, don’t give up. You can still keep taking Chantix.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Chantix can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for any unusual changes in mood or behavior including depression, agitation or hostility, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Chantix can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for any unusual changes in mood or behavior including depression, agitation or hostility, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Chantix can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

description_processed.orig: Chantix can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Interaction with alcohol
risks_warnings.description: Chantix has been shown to increase the effects of alcohol, including aggressive behavior followed by forgetting what happened. Decrease the amount of alcohol you consume until you understand how Chantix affects you.

description_processed.orig: Chantix has been shown to increase the effects of alcohol, including aggressive behavior followed by forgetting what happened. Decrease the amount of alcohol you consume until you understand how Chantix affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems (cardiovascular risk)
risks_warnings.description: You might be more sensitive to having a heart problem if you're already taking medicine to lower your blood pressure so be careful. It's important that you tell your doctor if you have symptoms of a heart attack (such as chest discomfort or pain) or stroke (trouble walking, speaking, understanding, or numbness of the face, arm, or legs).

description_processed.orig: You might be more sensitive to having a heart problem if you're already taking medicine to lower your blood pressure so be careful. It's important that you tell your doctor if you have symptoms of a heart attack (such as chest discomfort or pain) or stroke (trouble walking, speaking, understanding, or numbness of the face, arm, or legs).

risks_warnings.title: Accidental injury
risks_warnings.description: Use caution when operating machinery (like cars) since some people have reported being involved in traffic accidents while taking Chantix.

description_processed.orig: Use caution when operating machinery (like cars) since some people have reported being involved in traffic accidents while taking Chantix.

risks_warnings.title: Angioedema and hypersensitivity reactions (face and skin reactions)
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of face, mouth, or neck swelling when taking Chantix. Some patients have had a rare but serious skin condition known as Steven-Johnson Syndrome. If you experience any of these symptoms, stop taking Chantix and talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of face, mouth, or neck swelling when taking Chantix. Some patients have had a rare but serious skin condition known as Steven-Johnson Syndrome. If you experience any of these symptoms, stop taking Chantix and talk to your doctor right away.

carousel_items: Wellbutrin makes you energized, so take it in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping later that night.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
There are no sexual side effects from this medication.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The extended-release tablet shell can show up unchanged in your stool, but don't worry since the medication was still absorbed by your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Wellbutrin is an atypical antidepressant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Wellbutrin is good for treating depression and has fewer sexual side effects than other antidepressants, but you need to be okay with avoiding alcohol.
downsides: Wellbutrin can be stimulating, so it can cause anxiety or insomnia the first few days you're taking it.
Generally not as good as other antidepressants for people who have anxiety.
It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antidepressants.
Has a higher risk of causing seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder, eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol. So, it's not a good medication if you drink a lot.
It contains the same ingredient as a medication that helps you to stop smoking, (Zyban), so these two meds can't be used together.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

downsides_processed.orig: Wellbutrin can be stimulating, so it can cause anxiety or insomnia the first few days you're taking it.
Generally not as good as other antidepressants for people who have anxiety.
It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antidepressants.
Has a higher risk of causing seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder, eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol. So, it's not a good medication if you drink a lot.
It contains the same ingredient as a medication that helps you to stop smoking, (Zyban), so these two meds can't be used together.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving depression symptoms.
Causes fewer sexual side effects than other antidepressants. Can actually boost sex drive for some people.
Can be taken with other antidepressants to counteract their sexual side effects.
Has some stimulant effects, so it can be energizing.
Can help with ADHD symptoms.
Also used to suppress appetite and help you quit smoking.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

drugs.name: Wellbutrin

off-label_indications.indication: Sexual dysfunction from taking SSRI antidepressant

carousel_items_processed.orig: Wellbutrin makes you energized, so take it in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping later that night.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
There are no sexual side effects from this medication.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The extended-release tablet shell can show up unchanged in your stool, but don't worry since the medication was still absorbed by your body.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Wellbutrin is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Wellbutrin is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric effects for smoking cessation
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin is not approved for smoking cessation, but bupropion under the name Zyban is approved for this use. Some people taking it for smoking cessation have reported serious psychiatric effects, such as depression and, rarely, suicidal thoughts or behavior. These effects may be worse if you're withdrawing from nicotine because depression can be symptom of nicotine withdrawal. Watch for any sudden changes in mood, thinking, or behavior, and report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin is not approved for smoking cessation, but bupropion under the name Zyban is approved for this use. Some people taking it for smoking cessation have reported serious psychiatric effects, such as depression and, rarely, suicidal thoughts or behavior. These effects may be worse if you're withdrawing from nicotine because depression can be symptom of nicotine withdrawal. Watch for any sudden changes in mood, thinking, or behavior, and report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Weight loss
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin may cause weight loss. Talk to your doctor if weight loss is not desirable.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin may cause weight loss. Talk to your doctor if weight loss is not desirable.

carousel_items: Start treatment at least 1 week before target quit date and continue for 7-12 weeks. Can be used with nicotine replacement therapy. Take in the morning. Notify your healthcare provider for sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyban is an atypical antidepressant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Good for blocking the withdrawal symptoms of quitting smoking. But you need to be okay with avoiding alcohol use and possibly using nicotine replacement.
downsides: Can be stimulating, so it can cause some anxiety or insomnia in the first few days.
Higher risk of seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder or eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol.
Not a good medication for you if you drink a lot.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
If you are a heavy smoker you may also need to use nicotine replacement like the patch.

downsides_processed.orig: Can be stimulating, so it can cause some anxiety or insomnia in the first few days.
Higher risk of seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder or eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol.
Not a good medication for you if you drink a lot.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
If you are a heavy smoker you may also need to use nicotine replacement like the patch.

upsides: Can help relieve the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking.
Fewer sexual side effects compared to other antidepressants. Can actually boost sex drive for some people.
Zyban does not contain nicotine, so it is not dangerous if you continue to smoke. You can even use nicotine replacement like the patch while you are taking Zyban
Has some stimulant effects, so it can be energizing.
Six out of every 10 people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

drugs.name: Zyban

carousel_items_processed.orig: Start treatment at least 1 week before target quit date and continue for 7-12 weeks. Can be used with nicotine replacement therapy. Take in the morning. Notify your healthcare provider for sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric effects for quitting smoking
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Zyban for smoking cessation have reported serious psychiatric effects, such as depression and, rarely, suicidal thoughts or behavior. These effects may be worse if you're withdrawing from nicotine because depression can be symptom of nicotine withdrawal. Watch for any sudden changes in mood, thinking, or behavior, and report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

It is not known if Zyban safe children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Zyban may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Zyban can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

description_processed.orig: Zyban can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Hypertension
risks_warnings.description: Zyban can cause your blood pressure to go up. Patients taking MAOIs or using the nicotine patch should monitor their blood pressure.
risk_factors: Those taking MAOIs or using a nicotine patch

description_processed.orig: Zyban can cause your blood pressure to go up. Patients taking MAOIs or using the nicotine patch should monitor their blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Angle-closure Glaucoma
risks_warnings.description: Zyban may cause sudden nearsightedness or angle-closure glaucoma, especially if you have an allergy to penicillin or antibiotics with sulfonamides. This can lead to permanent blindness if not treated away. Tell your prescriber if you have these allergies, or if you suddenly develop sudden eye pain or changes in vision.

description_processed.orig: Zyban may cause sudden nearsightedness or angle-closure glaucoma, especially if you have an allergy to penicillin or antibiotics with sulfonamides. This can lead to permanent blindness if not treated away. Tell your prescriber if you have these allergies, or if you suddenly develop sudden eye pain or changes in vision.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Zyban can cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). This is a medical emergency and you get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: Zyban can cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). This is a medical emergency and you get medical attention immediately.

carousel_items: Usually taken together with other medicines for better blood pressure control.
Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
The weekly patch form can have fewer side effects.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release tablet also used to treat ADHD.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. It works in the brain to tell your blood vessels to relax, and it lowers the activity of certain stress hormones. This lowers blood pressure.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a good addition if you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure, but it has a lot of side effects. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be added to other blood pressure-lowering medicines if you need additional blood pressure control.
Available in a weekly patch for people that aren't good at taking medicine by mouth.
Works in the brain, so it can help treat some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.
Under the brand name Kapvay, it's used to treat ADHD in children and teenagers.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be added to other blood pressure-lowering medicines if you need additional blood pressure control.
Available in a weekly patch for people that aren't good at taking medicine by mouth.
Works in the brain, so it can help treat some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.
Under the brand name Kapvay, it's used to treat ADHD in children and teenagers.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: It's hard to deal with the drowsiness at work or school. Even on days off it will knock me out for half an hour then leave me drained for hours afterward. Look into other meds.
Seemed to cause heart palpitations, and bp elevated again immediately prior to next dose.

drugs.name: Catapres

carousel_items_processed.orig: Usually taken together with other medicines for better blood pressure control.
Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
The weekly patch form can have fewer side effects.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release tablet also used to treat ADHD.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.
risk_factors: Using other medicine(s) that slows the heart

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.

carousel_items: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

drugs.one_liner: Treats ADHD and lowers blood pressure.

For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure (hypotension)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

carousel_items: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). It helps improve your mood by altering the levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and other similar chemicals in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Nortriptyline is a good option for treating depression, especially for people who also have problems with persistent nerve pain.
downsides: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

upsides: Helpful with treating certain types of pain, like migraines or nerve-related pain.
Generally well tolerated and has fewer side effects than other medicines in the same class of drugs.

upsides_processed.orig: Helpful with treating certain types of pain, like migraines or nerve-related pain.
Generally well tolerated and has fewer side effects than other medicines in the same class of drugs.

userStories.tip: It gives me crazy dry mouth, but it's totally worth it--SSRIs don't work for me. Nortriptyline does. It's been a godsend for my depression.
Take it at night around 7 and on 30mg but so far its working better than the Lyrica did

drugs.name: Pamelor

carousel_items_processed.orig: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Nortriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 10.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Nortriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 10.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. Be careful since you can feel dizzy or fall. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. Be careful since you can feel dizzy or fall. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline has a moderate risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline has a moderate risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.
